Description: Five beads of different shape and material. A: Two cylindrical segmented beads made of faience with turquoise glaze, the longer one has four segments preserved. B: Elongated spherical bead made of turquoise faience. C: Barrel-shaped bead made of a white stone, one end is broken off, roughly shaped, not smoothed yet. D: One small disc-shaped bead made of turquoise faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), G6.X, over pits
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
